title: Graves is so broken.
body: Just played 100 percent crit graves. I 1v3d full build in their base. Jhin kept trying to crit me and he took me down to 300 health in a single auto. Then i healed back to full health with one auto and proceeded to 2 shot jhin. My build was skirmishers sabre warrior, phantom dancer, berserkers greaves, infinity edge, statikk shiv, essence reaver. Then i sold boots for deaths dance and skirmishers for bloodthirster.

replies.body:
A lot of the hate (and popularity) for graves has died down, but he's still as BS as he was since he was reworked. All he needs is Sterek's and his free resistances and he has the effective stats of a tank with the burst of an assassin and DPS only slightly less than a normal ADC. All that with mobility, above average affinity with lifesteal, and extreme pushing power.

The only thing graves doesn't have is a cigar.

Graves is a ranged, melee, tanky dps, assassin, mage, tank, support, and jungler

He just needs to be solidified to one role. Do they want him as an ADC? Then get rid of all the free stats and the area of effect damage he has as neither of those stats can be balanced on an ADC (at least from what I have seen). Do they want him as a jungler? Grave is, in many ways, problematic. But in other ways, he's got a whole bunch of issues to play around. For example, Skill Shot Auto Attacks. In a team fight, with a number of tanks in your way, you could see this being a problem.

I don't know how to feel about this, to be honest.

his team fights dont matter because of how strong of a duelist he is.  IMO quinn and graves seem pretty similar to me, they both deal absurd damage while having some range. but quinn can have that absurd damage while not being as tanky as a super minion.

Because she trades tanking for a butt ton of mobility in an ult and has a far more reliable kit. But, unfortunately, you have to keep in mind that team fights DO matter. Once the game hits the point of everyone flocking together and waiting to see which person done effs up first, Graves either works with the team or risks being picked off. I am sad to say that the latter is far more often the case in my experience.

Don't get me wrong, I really do not feel strongly against or for Graves. He's just a pain to deal with. But I do not know if being a pain to deal with is what makes a champion broken. A lot of champions are a pain. All of them, in fact. 

You're right. He has an incredible burst. But if they WERE to do something to balance him, I would think that the best thing to do would be to make his Q (his gunpowder boom boom thing) have the same delay if it hits a wall as it does when it doesn't. Unless that's changed recently, I don't know, I so rarely see him.
